newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq surges after favorable employment report.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq surges after favorable employment report.

text.p: Nasdaq shares jumped along with the Dow industrials and bond prices after the release of a monthly employment report that was viewed by investors as generally favorable for the markets, traders said.
The Nasdaq composite index added 14.79 points, or 1.06 percent, to 1404.84. Advancing issues outnumbered decliners by a 24-to-17 ratio on total volume of 594 million.
"Basically, the whole market surged. The stocks followed the bonds, which just surged after people sifted through the numbers," one trader said, referring to the employment data.
The rally benefited both large-cap and small-cap stocks, traders said. The Russell 2000 index gained 2.13 points, or 0.55 percent, to a closing high of 387.12.

Technology stocks firmed Friday, with Intel Corp adding 2-55/64 to 146, and Microsoft Corp gaining 3-1/2 to 124-1/16. Dell Computer Corp increased 3-11/16 to 112-1/8. Avant! Corp jumped 3-7/8 to 25 after a contract with Lucent Technologies Inc's Microelectronics Group was extended.
Elsewhere, Storage Dimensions Inc fell 3-15/16 to 6-5/16 after it warned its second-quarter results would fall short of earlier expectations.
